intro: Dichaeta tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf dichaeta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are often clustered at the ends of the branches. Dichaeta tenella is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
